details: Reviewed repository layout and noted recent cache updates under R/cache.R and supporting scripts.
Executed pytest to gauge current state; observed failures in isoform integration test and mapper unit test due to missing PSM helper export and offline UniProt lookup.
Restored prepare_psm_file/read_psm_file exports via site_annotate.io package init for backwards compatibility.
Hardened mapper.add_uniprot cache path to tolerate sandboxed environments and normalise legacy cache rows.
Re-ran targeted and full pytest suites; all 37 tests now pass.
Transitioning attention to R tooling, starting with cache layer and run pipeline integration.
Executed bash test.sh to exercise existing R unit suites; initial cache tests revealed gaps prompting further work.
Parameterised cache DB/RDS locations via options hook, added RDS path normalisation, and created targeted testthat coverage for cache hits, RDS thresholding, and DB fallback.
Re-ran bash test.sh and full pytest suite; all R and Python tests pass with new cache coverage.
Refined cache DB helpers to manage connections via NA-aware close flags and ensured every code path disconnects, eliminating the lingering dbDisconnect warning.
Re-ran bash test.sh and pytest; all R and Python suites remain green without connection warnings.
Added pytest module to ensure key site_annotate packages import cleanly and validate io re-exports.
Expanded suite now runs 49 tests after new coverage.
Extended prepare_psm_file to map DIANN-style columns (sequence, protein_ids, precursor area) into the canonical PSM schema and normalise protein identifiers.
Expanded io tests with DIANN-like fixture; full pytest now covers 50 cases.
Sanitized DIANN site occupancy strings, mapped UniMod identifiers to canonical modi columns, and verified oxidation/phospho coverage via new tests.
Updated mapper.add_uniprot to harvest UniProt IDs from DIANN Protein.Ids when offline, with regression coverage.
Tightened FASTA protein alignment: normalised ENSP strings, dropped unmatched PSMs, and expanded UniMod/UniProt fallbacks.
load_and_validate_files now retries FASTA alignment via UniProt IDs before dropping rows, logging remaining misses.
Reuse matched UniProtâ†’FASTA relationships when unique, drop leftover outliers instead of crashing downstream.
create_15mer now yields None for out-of-bounds positions rather than raising.
Index FASTA headers by ENSP/ENST/ENSG/geneID/symbol and UniProt (when available) to recover unmatched proteins; expand DIANN rows when multiple matches exist.
Populated *_best_localization columns from DIANN site probabilities and kept fallback filtering from dropping every row.
Treat DIANN precursor_lib_index as the canonical spectrum id and surface *_best_localization probabilities from site occupancy strings.
Switched ProcessPoolExecutor to multiprocessing spawn context to avoid fork-in-multithread warnings.
Added config flag to skip heatmap z-scoring; scale_gct now honors apply_z.
Added dry-run CLI for metadata/file mapping with optional LaTeX summary; implemented GCT reader and compare-protein command for site vs protein ratios.

Added Jinja2-based LaTeX report helper and limma-report CLI with optional Ollama summarization; fixed R limma loader here::here and lazyloader robustness; R tests pass except one env scoping issue in run_limma test.
Enhanced compare-protein with auto join key selection, GCT/Excel outputs, and options for metric selection and unmatched row handling.
Extended auto join to case-insensitive matching across rdesc columns, selecting the best pair (site/protein) by matched site rows.
Refactored compare-protein into site_annotate.compare and enforced numeric conversion to avoid numpy log2 TypeError with object dtype.
Renamed compare-protein flags to avoid shadowing write_gct/write_excel functions and restored output writing.
Added per-gene heatmap generation to compare-protein via ComplexHeatmap (genes option) with R script integration.
Adjusted ComplexHeatmap render: legend at bottom, wider page for x-axis labels, and replaced underscores in labels with spaces.
Robust numeric conversion and drop-all-NA guard in plot_gene_heatmap.R to avoid rownames<- errors when single-row/col or all-NA.
Added dataset-wide color scaling for raw and z-scored heatmaps via --scale-min/--scale-max; Python now computes global ranges and passes them to R.
